descriptions: The project website (created from ground up for this project)
Kleinkram data sharing web interface
A localization benchmark for the GrandTour dataset built via the API of eval.ai
More details and code: Boxi project repository for robust robot autonomy sensor payload
ANYmal Research: An online forum for discussion about ANYmal robots
grand_tour_box: Main repository that contains the pre- and post- processing scripts.
grand_tour_dataset: Contains simple examples on how to use the data and acts as a bridge between the developer team and the public.
grand_tour_webpage: Front-end HTML for the webpage. Webpage itself is available to the public.
grand_tour_benchmark: Backend for the localization benchmark. The benchmark itself is available to the public.
The GrandTour Dataset. This is one of the main contributions of the project. The data is stored in the ETH Zurich server and accessible through the “Kleinkram” interface.

New software tools developed as part of the data preparation process for public release on the Kleinkram platform, including data verification utilities such as tools for matching gyroscope angular velocity and additional data post-processing modules.
Kleinkram: Robotic Systems Lab structured bag and mcap storage solution
Boxi: Code and details for robust robot autonomy sensor payload
Boxi mobile sensor suite 'cookbook' providing guidelines and lessons learned for design and use of sensor payloads
Planned/expected workshop at IEEE ICRA 2026 in Vienna to present the dataset.
Collaboration and training event with industrial partner (Leica Geosystems) involving training on device usage and provision of tutorials on integrating robotic sensing with Robot Operating System.
A technical report of one of the data collection expeditions.
A journal publication in International Journal of Robotics Research (IJRR) is currently underway, describing the dataset in question.
A major publication, already accepted, describing the software & hardware and the motivation of the dataset collection.

Frey, J., Tuna, T., Fu, L. F. T., Weibel, C., Patterson, K., Krummenacher, B., ... & Hutter, M. (2025). Boxi: Design Decisions in the Context of Algorithmic Performance for Robotics. In Robotics: Science and Systems Conference (RSS 2025).
Presentation of the publication 'Boxi: Design Decisions in the Context of Algorithmic Performance for Robotics' at RSS 2025 conference.
Boxi: Design Decisions in the Context of Algorithmic Performance for Robotics presented as Poster Session in RSS 2025, Session 14, Tuesday, June 24, 12:30-2:00 PM
Planned workshop at IEEE ICRA 2026 for researchers to discuss the dataset and benchmark; planned online seminar series describing data usage.
Collaboration with University of Oxford, ORI-DRS lab under the supervision of Prof. Maurice Fallon to extend the GrandTour dataset and overlap with established datasets.
Co-development of Boxi with Leica Geosystems
Collaboration between ETH Zurich, University of Oxford, and Max Planck Institute for Intelligent Systems on Boxi project and publication
Collaboration with Leica Geosystems and Hexagon to utilize their devices for robotics purposes and extend the dataset.
Collaboration with Leica Geosystems for Boxi sensor payload development
Approximately 400 immediate users, with an additional 400 expected through upcoming community outreach including the planned IEEE ICRA 2026 Workshop.

websites_platforms.reasoning: Combined results from both JSON blocks, totaling 5 distinct new or enhanced websites, web interfaces, or platforms. All descriptions and URLs are reported as found, with no duplicates. Confidence and parsing scores are averaged or carried over as required.

software_tools.reasoning: Combined outputs from both entries, avoiding duplication: 'New software tools for the Kleinkram platform' (including data verification/post-processing) is counted as one, 'Kleinkram' as a storage solution is another, and 'Boxi' as the payload software is third. Total is 3 outputs, with their respective descriptions and the one explicit URL provided. Confidence values taken directly or averaged where appropriate.

models_standards.reasoning: The later section (idx:1, p.7-11) provides a specific output matching the category, overriding the preceding section indicating zero. There is one documented relevant output with description, no URLs given.

training_events.reasoning: Only one event described in idx 0; idx 1 confirms no additional events. Description and confidence scores are verbatim from the source.

publications.reasoning: Descriptions and URLs were compiled from both JSON objects, with confirmation that each description and URL is unique. Confidence values were reported verbatim as given. The new scientific publication from idx 1 is distinct from the prior three. This results in four total publications with the provided details.

presentations.reasoning: Both extracted entries pertain to the same presentation (the 'Boxi' publication at RSS 2025, given as a conference talk or poster). Thus, there is only one unique presentation; using both descriptions for additional detail. Only one URL is available. VERBATIM EXTRACTION for all values, with deduplication as per instructions.

new_collaborations.reasoning: Combined data from both extractions. Each collaboration is described distinctly according to source, and total count is sum of unique descriptions. Confidence and description values are reported as provided in the source JSON. VERBATIM EXTRACTION.

industrial_collaborations.reasoning: Both entries refer to industrial collaborations, specifically with Leica Geosystems (and Hexagon in one). These likely represent the same general collaboration but are described differently; they are kept as separate descriptions for completeness while quantity is kept as 1, in line with the provided data. No URLs are present in the text. VERBATIM EXTRACTION.

other_outputs.reasoning: Both data sources indicate no entries for 'Other outputs (please specify)'. No descriptions or URLs are present. VERBATIM EXTRACTION.

config.system_prompt:
EXTRACTION STRATEGY:
  1. PRIMARY: Look for data in the specified location/table/section
  2. FALLBACK: If not found, search broader document context for semantically equivalent information
  3. FLEXIBILITY: Allow for format variations, OCR errors, and synonym usage

  LOCATION FLEXIBILITY:
  - Handle table format variations (column/row order, spacing, naming)
  - Consider synonyms and equivalent terms
  - Account for OCR/parsing errors that may affect document quality

  QUALITY STANDARDS:
  - Extract actual values found in the document
  - If uncertain, provide best interpretation with appropriate confidence
  - Only return null if the information category truly doesn't exist
  - Convert abbreviated amounts (k=1000) to full numbers where applicable
  

  REPORT OUTPUT FOCUS:
  - 15 standard output categories in "List of Outputs" table
  - Each category: quantity number, descriptions list, URLs list
  - Separate descriptions from URLs even when mixed in same cell
  - Academic collaborations vs Industrial partnerships (distinct categories)
  - Preserve all detailed descriptions and web addresses
